entries: The Rosselbuck makes one antler attack and one kick attack.

action.name: Antler
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the Rosselbuck jumps or glides at least 30 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space occupied by one or more other creatures. Each of these creatures must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the Rosselbuck's space into an adjacent unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the Rosselbuck's space.

legendary.name: Kick
entries: The Rosselbuck makes a kick attack.

legendary.name: Howl of the Predator (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Rosselbuck releases an unnatural, terrifying howl. Each creature within 30 feet of the Rosselbuck that can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Creatures who fail the saving throw are also {@condition restrained} until the end of the Rosselbuck's next turn. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Corvum Songweaver
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, the songweaver can spend a reaction to fly up to its speed in one direction as it descends. It lands in an unoccupied space at the end of its movement, and takes no falling damage. The songweaver can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though it can drop any held items as part of its reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: The songweaver has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb any surface its talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Skulker
entries: The songweaver has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks made in dim light or total darkness.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The songweaver can Sing. It then makes two attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sing {@recharge 5}
entries: The songweaver sings a song infused with magic. Each song targets any number of creatures within 30 feet of the songweaver. A creature must be able to hear the songweaver sing in order to be affected by its song. Each time the songweaver takes this action, it can choose from one of the following effects:

items.name: Dirge of Sorrow
entries: All targeted creatures must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws made before the start of the songweaver's next turn.

items.name: Hero's Ballad
entries: All targeted creatures gain 4 ({@dice 1d4 + 2}) temporary hit points and advantage on attack rolls made before the start of the songweaver's next turn.

items.name: Traveler's Tune
entries: All targeted creatures can spend their reactions to move up to their speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Bitter Taste
entries: If the cosmoth takes damage from a bite attack, the attacker takes 7 {@dice 2d6} points of poison damage and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cosmoth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 6d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The cursed slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Cursed
entries: Any creature that touches the slime or hits it with a melee attack must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The slime can climb difficult surfaces, including vertically and upside down, without making an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Slime Curse
entries: The cursed slime splashes a sticky, foul-smelling residue on a creature within 30 feet of it that hits it with an attack. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed until the end of the slime's next turn. Creatures under this curse have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

monster.name: Drella Swoop
languages: Vulpin understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Drella can spend a reaction to fly up to her speed in one direction as she descends. She lands in an unoccupied space at the end of her movement and takes no falling damage. She cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though she can drop any held items as part of her reaction).

trait.name: Wing Flap
entries: As a bonus action, Drella can use her powerful feathered arms to propel herself upward up to half her movement speed. Drella can use this in conjunction with a regular jump, but not while gliding.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of her turns, Drella can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Fated (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Drella can choose to reroll any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Drella deals an extra 14 {@damage 4d6} damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Drella's that isn't incapacitated and Drella doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Touched
entries: Drella knows the shocking grasp cantrip. Charisma is her spellcasting ability for this cantrip (Spell attack +5).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Drella makes two dagger attacks. She can replace one of these attacks with a shocking grasp.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature they must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, becoming {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failure. Drella has three {@condition poisoned} daggers on her person which she prepared ahead of time. The poison dries and becomes useless 1 hour after its application.

action.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, they can't take reactions until the start of Drella's next turn.

action.name: Songbird (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Drella casts the {@spell charm person} spell at 1st level without using a spell slot or somatic components. Charisma is her spellcasting ability for this spell (save {@dc 13}).

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The dusktail has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Resilience
entries: The dusktail has advantage on saving throws made to resist being {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

monster.name: Elora Quickwit
languages: Vulpin understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Elora can spend a reaction to fly up to her speed in one direction as she descends. She lands in an unoccupied space at the end of her movement, and takes no falling damage. Elora can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though she can drop any held items as part of her reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: Elora has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb any surface her talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Convincing
entries: Elora has advantage on all Charisma checks made to convince someone of her knowledge of anything pertaining to the {@skill History} skill.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: Elora can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Elora deals an extra 10 {@damage 3d6} damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Elora's that isn't incapacitated and Elora doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Elora makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge (3/Day)
entries: Elora halves the damage from an attack that hits her. Elora must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The everbug has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Noxious Defense (1/Day)
entries: The everbug secretes a noxious liquid with a potent stench. For the next minute, each creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the everbug, or that enters within 5 feet of the everbug for the first time each turn must succeed on a {@dc 12} saving throw against the stench or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Evasive Maneuvers
entries: While flying, the firelance's armor class is equal to its passive {@skill Acrobatics} check.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points.

monster.name: Frond Bellewether
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Frond can spend a reaction to fly up to her speed in one direction as she descends. Frond lands in an unoccupied space at the end of her movement and takes no falling damage. Frond cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though she can drop any held items as part of her reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: Frond has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb any surface her talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Aerial Defense
entries: As long as Frond is falling, gliding, or jumping, attacks made against her have disadvantage.

trait.name: Woodland Hunter
entries: Frond treats three-quarters cover as half cover and half cover as no cover.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Frond makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target.{@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The fungusfeaster can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Fungiphage
entries: The fungusfeaster's pseudopod attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage to fungi and fungus creatures such as shriekers and violet fungi. The fungusfeaster regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The fungusfeaster can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Cold Tolerance
entries: The gargath can exist comfortably in temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit. It has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to resist effects that deal cold damage.

trait.name: Stampede
entries: If the gargath moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone}, the gargath can then make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stomp

She lands in an unoccupied space at the end of her movement, and takes no falling damage. Gerta can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though she can drop any held items as part of her reaction).

entries: Gerta has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Patterned Feathers

trait.name: Talons

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Glass Song (1/Day)
entries: The glassbeetle weaves a strange and beautiful melody, which it can maintain for up to 10 minutes, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Creatures within 100 feet of the glassbeetle who can hear this song must succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the glassbeetle for as long as they can hear the music.

trait.name: Taunt (2/Day)
entries: Gurt can use a bonus action on their turn to target one creature within 30 feet of them. If the target can hear Gurt, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of Gurt's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gurt makes two weapon attacks, one with their rapier and one with their dagger.

action.name: Rapier

entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Hannity can spend a reaction to fly up to her speed in one direction as she descends. entries: If Horns moves at least 20 feet in a straight line towards an enemy, his antler attack deals an extra 3 {@dice 1d6} points of piercing damage. If the target of the charge is Large or smaller, they must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from Horns.

trait.name: Surge of Vigor (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: If Horns is dealt damage equal to half or more of his current remaining hit points (even if his HP is reduced to 0 by the attack), he immediately regains 8 ({@dice 1d12 + 2}) hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Horns makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Horns adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Horns must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The amphithere can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The young amphithere exhales a blast of stinging venom in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this attack remains stable but is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points. If a creature has total cover from the young amphithere, it is not affected by the breath attack.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The commoner's long jump is 30 feet, and its base high jump is 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Team Tactics
entries: The commoner can take the Help action as a bonus action.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage

resist.note: from Nonmagical Attacks that aren't Silvered

trait.name: Death in Shadow
entries: When the jerbeen horror dies, its body and its equipment dissolve into shadows and disappear, leaving nothing behind.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jerbeen makes three dagger attacks or two shortbow attacks. It can use its Frostbite Touch in place of one dagger attack.

action.name: Frostbite Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Dagger
entries: Melee or ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 feet, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Explorer
entries: As long as she is outside and can see the sky, Jonall can always tell which way is north. If given one minute with a map to find her bearings, she can always identify the safest, most direct route to a location.

trait.name: Hard Headed
entries: If Jonall moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a headbutt attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sure Footing
entries: Jonall ignores nonmagical difficult terrain.

trait.name: Traveler's Tales
entries: Jonall makes {@skill History} checks with advantage for anything related to towns, cities, or prominent regional features, such as unique geographic formations or landmarks.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit; reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Natural Camouflage
entries: The prowler has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made in the forest. Creatures who attack a target that cannot see them have advantage on their attack roll.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the prowler moves at least 10 feet toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The prowler can use its bonus action to make another claw attack against this target.

trait.name: Ambuscade
entries: The prowler can take the Dash or Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prowler makes one claw attack and one bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target of the bite attack is {@condition prone}, it takes an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Death in Shadow
entries: When the fang dies, its body dissolves into shadows and disappears, leaving nothing behind.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The fang has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Shadow Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the fang's darkvision.

trait.name: Shadow Stalk
entries: The fang can hover 5 feet above land or water as part of its movement, requiring no action. While hovering, it is unaffected by difficult terrain and makes no sound as it moves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shadow Manipulation {@recharge 5}
entries: The fang conjures chilling shadows near itself. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from the fang must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area inside the cube is heavily obscured by magical darkness until the start of the fang's next turn.

trait.name: Soulful Rhapsody (2/Day)
entries: Moonflower can use a bonus action on her turn to target one creature within 30 feet of her. If the target can hear Moonflower, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become overcome with emotion from Moonflower's performance, becoming {@condition incapacitated} until the start of Moonflower's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Moonflower makes two weapon attacks with her rapier.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Curl Up
entries: Moonflower curls up into a spiny ball. While curled up in this way she cannot move, attack, or cast spells with somatic components, and her base armor class becomes 19. Any creature that misses Moonflower with a melee attack while she is curled up takes {@dice 2d4} points of piercing damage from her sharp quills. If a creature hits the bard while she is curled up, however, Moonflower is knocked {@condition prone} in her space at the end of the turn. Moonflower may uncurl themselves at any point during her turn.

When falling at least 10 feet, Petra can spend a reaction to gain resistance to falling damage until the end of the turn. Petra can't do this if she is carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though she can drop any held items as part of her reaction).

entries: Petra adds 2 to her AC against one melee attack that would hit her. To do so, Petra must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Phorosfeather is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). Phorosfeather has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Phorosfeather can spend a reaction to fly up to his speed in one direction as He descends. He lands in an unoccupied space at the end of his movement, and takes no falling damage. Phorosfeather can't glide while carrying heavy objects, or heavy weapons (though he can drop any held items as part of his reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: Phorosfeather has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb any surface his talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Aerial Defense
entries: As long as Phorosfeather is falling, gliding, or jumping, attacks made against him have disadvantage.

trait.name: Gesme's Wrath
entries: As a bonus action, Phorosfeather can expend a spell slot to cause his melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If Phorosfeather expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Woodland Hunter
entries: Phorosfeather treats three-quarters cover as half cover and half cover as no cover.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Pleasantpaw
languages: Hedge can speak with beasts of any size

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Plesantpaw is a 4th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Racket (2/Day)
entries: Pleasantpaw can use a bonus action on his turn to target any number of creatures within 30 feet of him. Any of these creatures that can hear Pleasantpaw play or croon his music must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws for one minute. A creature can attempt a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature that succeeds on their saving throw against this effect, or has the effect ended for it, is immune to Pleasantpaw's racket for 24 hours. Creatures that are immune to being {@condition frightened} are immune to this effect.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Curl Up
entries: Pleasantpaw curls up into a spiny ball. While curled up in this way he can't move, attack, or cast spells with somatic components, and his base armor class becomes 19. Any creature that misses Pleasantpaw with a melee attack while he is curled up takes {@dice 2d4} points of piercing damage from his sharp quills. If a creature hits Pleasantpaw while he is curled up, however, Pleasantpaw is knocked {@condition prone} in his space at the end of the turn. Pleasantpaw may uncurl himself at any point during his turn.

monster.name: Podge
languages: Vulpin can speak with beasts of any size which represent spiders

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Podge is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following bard spells prepared:

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Curl Up
entries: Podge curls up into a spiny ball. While curled up in this way he cannot move, attack, or cast spells with somatic components, and his base armor class becomes 19. Any creature that misses Podge with a melee attack while they are curled up takes {@dice 2d4} points of piercing damage from their sharp quills. If a creature hits Podge while he is curled up, however, Podge is knocked {@condition prone} in his space at the end of the turn. Podge may uncurl himself at any point during his turn.

reaction.name: Mocking Distraction
entries: Podge hurls jarring insults at an attacking creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The creature rolls {@dice 1d4} and subtracts the result from their attack roll, potentially causing the attack to miss. A creature must be able to hear Podge in order to be affected by their jeers.

monster.name: Raptor Deckhand
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, the deckhand can spend a reaction to fly up to its speed in one direction as it descends. It lands in an unoccupied space at the end of its movement, and takes no falling damage. The deckhand can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though it can drop any held items as part of its reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: The deckhand has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb any surface its talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The deckhand has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Patient
entries: When the deckhand reacts with a readied action, it has advantage on the first attack roll, skill check, or ability check it makes as a part of that action.

trait.name: Sure Footing
entries: The deckhand ignores non-magical difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deckhand makes two melee attacks or two attacks with its hand crossbow.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Raptor Freebooter
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, the freebooter can spend a reaction to fly up to its speed in one direction as it descends. It lands in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and takes no falling damage. The freebooter can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though it can drop any held items as part of its reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: The freebooter has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb any surface its talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Confidence
entries: The freebooter adds its Charisma modifier to its initiative rolls.

trait.name: Patient
entries: When the freebooter takes a readied action, it has advantage on the first attack roll, skill check, or ability check it makes as a part of that action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the freebooter deals an extra 3 {@damage 1d6} damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and it has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the freebooter that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the freebooter doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The freebooter makes two saber attacks and one talons attack or two attacks with its hand crossbow.

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Raptor Mercenary
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, the mercenary can spend a reaction to fly up to its speed in one direction as it descends. It lands in an unoccupied space at the end of its movement, and takes no falling damage. The mercenary can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though it can drop any held items as part of its reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: The mercenary has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb any surface its talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Aerial Defense
entries: As long as the mercenary is falling, gliding, or jumping, attacks made against it have disadvantage.

trait.name: Woodland Hunter
entries: The mercenary treats three-quarters cover as half cover and half cover as no cover.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mercenary makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Rosselbuck
languages: telepathy 120 ft. understands Cervan and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Rosselbuck has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Rosselbuck's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Loping Glide
entries: When falling or long jumping at least 30 feet, the Rosselbuck can spend a reaction to fly up to twice its speed in one direction as it descends. The Rosselbuck lands in an unoccupied space at the end of its movement and takes no falling damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Rosselbuck's long jump is up to 60 feet, and its high jump is up to 40 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Rosselbuck makes one antler attack and one kick attack.

action.name: Antler
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the Rosselbuck jumps or glides at least 30 feet as part of its movement, it can land on its feet in a space occupied by one or more other creatures. Each of these creatures must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the Rosselbuck's space into an adjacent unoccupied space of its choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the Rosselbuck's space.

legendary.name: Kick
entries: The Rosselbuck makes a kick attack.

legendary.name: Mantle of Spring Everlasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Rosselbuck spreads its wings, summoning a pocket of springtime breeze to its surroundings. All allies within 30 feet of the Rosselbuck gain 10 temporary hit points and may immediately spend up to 2 Hit Dice to recover hit points as though they were taking a short rest.

monster.name: Sage
languages: Mapach understands Auran but can't speak it

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sage is a 4th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Sage can spend a reaction to fly up to her speed in one direction as she descends. She lands in an unoccupied space at the end of her movement and takes no falling damage. She cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though she can drop any held items as part of her reaction).

trait.name: Seedspeech
entries: Sage can communicate simple ideas to living plants and is able to interpret their responses in simple language.

trait.name: Wing Flap
entries: As a bonus action, Sage can use her powerful feathered arms to propel herself upward up to half her movement speed. Sage can use it in conjunction with a regular jump, but not while gliding.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit ({@hit 4} to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

monster.name: Saltfeather
languages: Tilia understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Saltfeather can spend a reaction to fly up to his speed in one direction as he descends. He lands in an unoccupied space at the end of his movement and takes no falling damage. Saltfeather cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though he can drop any held items as part of his reaction).

trait.name: Hook and Talon
entries: Saltfeather has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb any surface his talons and silvered hook-hand could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Saltfeather deals an extra 17 {@damage 5d6} damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Saltfeather that isn't incapacitated and Saltfeather doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Skulker
entries: Saltfeather has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made in dim light or darkness.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Saltfeather makes three melee attacks: two with his cutlass and one with his hook.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. On a successful hit, Saltfeather may spend a bonus action to grapple the target (escape {@dc 11}). A target who escapes from this grapple must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage from the hook. This is a silvered weapon.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bomb (3/Day)
entries: After sparking his hook to light the fuse, Saltfeather lobs an iron shell filled with alchemical explosives. Choose a point within 60 feet of Saltfeather that he can see. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must attempt a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Saltfeather adds 3 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Saltfeather must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If not grappling a target with his hook, Saltfeather can use it to parry.

resist.note: from Nonmagical Attacks that aren't Silvered

trait.name: Death in Shadow
entries: When the shadowbeast dies, its body and its equipment dissolve into shadows and disappear, leaving nothing behind.

trait.name: Bristling Hide
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the shadowbeast deals 5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

trait.name: Shadow Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the shadowbeast's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shadowbeast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadowbeast makes three melee attacks: one with its tail and two with its slam.
Alternatively, it can use Spit Flame twice.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spit Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

monster.name: Skopps the Beast-Breaker
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but doesn't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Skopps can spend a reaction to fly up to his speed in one direction as he descends. Skopps lands in an unoccupied space at the end of his movement and takes no falling damage. Skopps cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though he can drop any held items as part of his reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: Skopps has advantage on ability checks made to climb any surface his talons could reasonably grip.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Skopps makes two attacks. He can then use his Beast Command action.

action.name: Barbed Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. After a hit, Skopps may spend a bonus action to grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Beast Command
entries: Skopps commands a beast or monstrosity within 80 feet of him that can hear him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Skopps until the end of his next turn. While the target is {@condition frightened} and Skopps is conscious, Skopps has a telepathic link with it, and can use this link to mentally control the creature. At the start of the controlled creature's turn, Skopps can decide what actions and movement the creature takes on its turn. The target takes only the actions Skopps commands, and doesn't do anything that Skopps doesn't allow it to do. Skopps can cause the creature to use a reaction at any time, but this requires Skopps to use his reaction as well. Each time the controlled creature takes damage, it makes a Wisdom saving throw against being {@condition frightened}. If the saving throw succeeds, this effect ends. Beast Command is a magical effect.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The slicar has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

trait.name: Adorable Monstrosity
entries: The slime has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Performance}) and Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Cute
entries: The slime is adorable. It can cast {@spell charm person} once per day without material components.

trait.name: Mucus
entries: When the slime is hit by a melee attack, the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or their weapon becomes stuck in the slime. The weapon can be wrenched out by using an action to make a {@dc 12} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, freeing the weapon on a success. All weapons stuck in the slime can be retrieved once the slime is slain.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Slime King's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The Slime King has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the Slime King sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

trait.name: Wallow in Waste
entries: The Slime King is immune to the effects of noxious gasses, such as those caused by the {@spell stinking cloud} and {@spell cloudkill} spells.

trait.name: Watchful Skulls
entries: The Slime King has two extra reactions that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Slime King makes three Bite attacks. It can replace one of its Bite attacks with a Slimeforged Blade attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slimeforged Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage. If the Slime King attacks a creature and rolls a 20 on its attack roll, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The Slime King makes a Bite attack.

legendary.name: Slimecasting
entries: The Slime King casts {@spell acid splash} or web.

legendary.name: Spread the Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Slime King sends out a spray of bone and slime. All enemies in a 10-foot radius centered on the Slime King must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The slime king can then cast {@spell bestow curse} on any creature that failed its saving throw.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The slimesworn cultist is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the slimesworn cultist must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: Dead Accurate
entries: If the slimesworn cultist is motionless, it looks merely like a dead mage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slimesworn cultist makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Fabric Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is also {@condition restrained} and must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the start of each its turns or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Slip Tideswell
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Slip can spend a reaction to fly up to his speed in one direction as he descends. He lands in an unoccupied space at the end of his movement, and takes no falling damage. Slip can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though he can drop any held items as part of his reaction).

trait.name: Drop Attack
entries: Slip can make an attack during his glide. If he does so, he deals an extra {@dice 1d8} points of damage.

trait.name: Patient
entries: When Slip takes a readied action, he has advantage on the first attack roll, skill check, or ability check he makes as a part of that action.

trait.name: Talons
entries: Slip has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb any surface his talons could reasonably grip.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: Slip reduces the damage dealt by one melee attack that would hit him by {@dice 1d8}, and deals that much piercing damage to his attacker. Slip must see the attacker and be wielding a rapier.

trait.name: Evasive
entries: Snap adds her Intelligence modifier as a bonus to his Dexterity saving throws (already included in stat block).

trait.name: Hunter's Eye (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Snap can add {@dice 1d8} to her next attack or damage roll made with a ranged weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Snap makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Snap adds 2 to her AC against one melee attack that would hit her. To do so, Snap must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: Snapshadow can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Lone Duelist
entries: When fighting a single creature, so long as there are no creatures within 5 feet of her or her opponent, Snapshadow has advantage on her attack rolls.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Snapshadow deals an extra 10 {@damage 3d6} damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Snapshadow that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Snapshadow doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Snapshadow's long jump is 40 feet, and her base high jump is 20 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Snapshadow makes three attacks: two with her cane rapier and one with her dagger.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: Snapshadow reduces the damage dealt by one melee attack that would hit her by({@dice 1d8}), and deals that much piercing damage to her attacker. Snapshadow must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of his turns, Spleck can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Forest Cunning
entries: Speck has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made in forests and jungle environments.

trait.name: Purifying Skin
entries: Speck has advantage on saving throws made to resist being {@condition poisoned} or infected with a disease.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Spleck deals an extra 7 {@damage 2d6} damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Spleck that isn't incapacitated and Spleck doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sticky Grip
entries: Spleck can climb upside down or on difficult surfaces without making ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Spleck makes two melee attacks with his dagger.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Sticky Tongue
entries: Spleck extends his long sticky tongue toward an object he can see within 20 feet of him. His sticky tongue grabs the object and pulls it to him in a straight line. If Spleck has free hands, he can immediately wield the object; otherwise, it drops at his feet. If the object is being held or carried by a creature, Spleck and that creature make opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks. If the creature wins, it maintains its hold on the object. Alternatively, if Spleck targets an object that is heavier than himself, he is instead pulled toward the object, provoking opportunity attacks as normal.

reaction.name: Poison Skin (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When a creature touches Spleck, hits him with a melee weapon attack using natural weapons, or grapples him, Spleck can cause that creature to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of Spleck's next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

monster.name: Stoa Mossbow
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Stoa can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

trait.name: Patterned Feathers
entries: Stoa has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks when they attempt to hide in a forest.

trait.name: Talons
entries: Stoa has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb any surface their talons could reasonably grip.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

monster.name: Strig Berserker
languages: Birdfolk understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, the berserker can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. The berserker can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

trait.name: Talons
entries: The berserker has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb any surface their talons could reasonably grip.

trait.name: Patterned Feathers
entries: The berserker has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks when they attempt to hide in a forest.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Smoke Weakness
entries: If a swarm starts its turn in a space that is either partially or entirely covered by smoke, its attacks have disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage, or 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable, but remains {@condition unconscious}, even after regaining hit points. An {@condition unconscious} creature can be woken by taking an action to shake it awake, otherwise the creature will awaken in 8 hours.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Resilience
entries: The swarm has advantage on saving throws made to resist being {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny squirrel. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Woodbore
entries: The swarm can burrow up to its speed through solid wood and tree bark, and its attacks ignore the damage threshold of objects made of wood.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage, or 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

variant.name: Gimlet Larvae
entries: Swarms of gimlet larvae are just as damaging to the tree as the beetle themselves. They use the same statistics listed for a swarm of gimlets, but with the characteristics described here.

items.name: Swarm of Gimlet Larvae
items.entry: A swarm of gimlet larvae has the following traits:

items.name: Speed
items.entry: The swarm of Gimlet larvae has a movement speed of 10 feet and a climb speed of 10 feet. It cannot fly.

entries: The swarm of gimlet larvae loses the bite attack listed in the swarm of gimlet's stat block and instead gains the following attack:

items.name: Acidic Mucus
items.entry: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., all targets in the swarm's space. Hit: 5 ({@dice 2d4}) acid damage, or 2 ({@dice 1d4}) acid damage if the swarm has half ofits hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Aerial Ace
entries: As long as she's flying, attacks against Tempa are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Borrowed Flight (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: Tempa has a fly speed of 60 feet and can hover. This lasts for 1 hour. Once the effect ends, she gently floats to earth. Tempa must finish a long rest within 5 feet of the infant amphithere to recharge this feature. This is a magical effect.

trait.name: Daring Action
entries: Tempa can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Help action.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Tempa's long jump is 30 feet, and her base high jump is 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Slingshot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Luck (3/Day)
entries: Tempa takes no damage from an attack.

monster.name: The Godfeather
languages: Vulpin understands Auran but can't speak it

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Godfeather is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (Spell Save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The Godfeather knows the following sorcerer spells.
footerEntries: ** The Godfeather casts this spell on himself before combat

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The Godfeather wears a {@item hat of disguise} and a {@item ring of mind shielding} to keep himself hidden from the watchful eyes of the Perch Guard.

trait.name: Fated (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Godfeather can choose to reroll any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, the Godfeather can spend a reaction to fly up to his speed in one direction as he descends. He lands in an unoccupied space at the end of his movement, and takes no falling damage. The Godfeather can't glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though he can drop any held items as part of his reaction).

trait.name: Resilience
entries: The Godfeather has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Wing Flap
entries: As a bonus action, the Godfeather can use his powerful feathered arms to propel himself 15 feet upward. The Godfeather can't use this ability while gliding.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage or 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Velma is a 1st-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). Velma has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Velma's long jump is 30 feet, and her base high jump is 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Team Tactics
entries: Velma can take the Help action as a bonus action.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

trait.name: Evasive
entries: The berserker adds its Intelligence modifier as a bonus to its Dexterity saving throws (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reachf 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Evasive
entries: The fanatic adds its Intelligence modifier as a bonus to its Dexterity saving throws (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The vulpin gloomweaver's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Death in Shadow
entries: When a vulpin gloomweaver dies, its body and its equipment dissolve into shadows and disappear, leaving behind a pile of fine silken clothing.

trait.name: Evasive
entries: The vulpin gloomweaver adds its Intelligence modifier as a bonus to its Dexterity saving throws (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: As a bonus action, the vulpin gloomweaver can teleport up to 60 feet as long as it begins and ends its teleportation in an area of shadow or darkness.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vulpin gloomweaver makes two shadow longbow attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shadow Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Shot (3/Day)
entries: The vulpin gloomweaver chooses an unoccupied space it can see within 150 feet of it. It shoots an arrow from its longbow, and a shadow emerges from the point where the arrow lands. The shadow is under its control, and disappears after 1 minute.

action.name: Shadow Conjuration (1/Day)
entries: The vulpin gloomweaver creates a shadow conjuration within an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. This conjuration uses the statistics of any beast with a challenge rating of 1 or lower, with the following changes:

items: The conjuration is resistant to necrotic damage.
The conjuration's attacks deal necrotic damage instead of their usual damage type.
The conjuration acts at the end of the gloomweaver's turn and uses its action to attack any creatures that are hostile to the gloomweaver.

monster.name: Vulpin Horror

resist.note: from Nonmagical Attacks that aren't Silvered

languages: Vulpin can understand Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Death in Shadow
entries: When the vulpin horror dies, its body dissolves into shadows and disappears, leaving nothing behind.

trait.name: Shadow Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the vulpin horror's darkvision.

trait.name: Shadowed Guile
entries: The vulpin horror's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: vicious mockery
1/day each: ambush prey, bane, mirror image

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vulpin horror makes one attack with its bite and one with its talons.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of their turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Evasive
entries: The spy adds their Intelligence modifier as a bonus to Dexterity saving throws (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The spy deals an extra 7 {@damage 2d6} damage when they hit a target with a weapon attack and have advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spy makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The young wakewyrm can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Plaintive Cry
entries: The young wakewyrm can spend a bonus action to call for its mother. As long as its mother is within 150 feet, and can hear its young, the mother may spend its reaction to swim up to 50 feet toward the young wakewyrm.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The young wakewyrm makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Zifa Freewind
languages: Hedge understands Auran but can't speak it

trait.name: Glide
entries: When falling at least 10 feet, Zifa can spend a reaction to fly up to her speed in one direction as she descends. Zifa lands in an unoccupied space at the end of her movement and takes no falling damage. Zifa cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though she can drop any held items as part of her reaction).

trait.name: Wing Flap
entries: As a bonus action, Zifa can use her powerful feathered arms to propel herself upward up to half her movement speed. Zifa can use this in conjunction with a regular jump, but not while gliding.

trait.name: Fated (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Zifa can choose to reroll any attack roll, skill check, or saving throw.

trait.name: Touched
entries: Zifa knows the fire bolt cantrip. Charisma is her spellcasting ability for this cantrip. Treat her as a 1st-level spellcaster when calculating the damage this cantrip deals.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Songbird (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Zifa casts the {@spell charm person} spell at 1st level without using a spell slot or somatic components. Charisma is her spellcasting ability for this spell (save {@dc 12}).

A disgraced vulpin tree-shaper and druid, Aida Reedmane found her way to Marshview from Alderheart more than five years ago. Elora sometimes makes use of Aida's talents to modify parts of Moss Hall, particularly when she wishes to hide something in plain sight.

The amphithere is a large aquatic serpent with a spiny tail fin and two large pectoral fins which it can flap to achieve powered flight. Its mouth contains venom-filled fangs as well as a forked tongue which it can use to sense its prey. Though it primarily resides in the sea feeding on schools of fish, it uses its fins to fly over coastal land to hunt whatever it can catch when fish are scarce.

Slimes are magical oozes with strange properties. Slimes provide an important role in many ecosystems across Humblewood, as their bodies can digest just about anything. The bodies of slimes are also sought after for use in potion making.

entries.name: Animated Slimes
entries: Animated slimes can morph into common objects for various uses: tables, benches, etc. Some have used them to help furnish the homes of the poor. Some animated slimes have gone rogue, acting as mundane pieces of furniture to lure prey into their clutches.

Arlowene is a middle-aged hedge who lives in Seawatch Tower, the large lighthouse within Saltar's Port. Arlowene is a trained healer and spellcaster, who has learned how to specialize in both wizardly abjuration and clerical healing magic. She abhors violence.

Named "The Seahawk" by Arlowene Lum, Arrevis is a raptor who wields his blade with a prowess forged through years of experience. He can join the fight at the end of this adventure, but he has just emerged from a coma and is weakened. Arrevis has the following character traits, which you can use to help roleplay him:

entries.name: Ideal:
entries: "Whatever I need to do to survive, I'll do it."

entries.name: Bonds:
entries: "Without a friend beside me, I'm lost. With someone, I can do anything."

entries.name: Flaws:
entries: "I can't resist the allure of power. I just can't get enough."

Aster Amaryllis, better known as Aster the Thorn, is a ruthless hedge captain of the Bandit Coalition. One of the organization's perpetual bad actors, Aster doesn't care for Benna's vision beyond how it can be used to inspire loyalty in his lackeys, and always has some side-operation running in secret to enrich himself. He is cruel, greedy, spiteful, and uncaring of the lives he tramples over in his pursuit of wealth.

The militia captain of Reya's Watch, Bernice is a loud and protective bright gallus. She lost her husband, a tender named Farnham, to a forest fire, and she sees her role with the militia as a continuation of his legacy.

Birdfolk in need of coin and lacking any moral scruples can find lucrative work as hired henchmen for one of Alderheart's various criminal factions. These common thugs often fight dirty, and are quick to flee when things don't go their way.

Bita is a bright gallus whose elegant white plumage resembles that of a peacock. As the Birdfolk Council's Speaker, she is always first to address those who have been granted an audience with the council. She takes her duties as the Speaker and a council member seriously. Despite her profound affection for Humblewood and its citizens, she often comes off as severe and cold. Bita believes in doing what's best for the folks of the Wood, but sometimes this means making level-headed and tough decisions.

Bullybird, also known as Finneas Klawk, is a gallus highwayman with ties to several criminal organizations across Alderheart. What Bullybird lacks in cunning he more than makes up for in brawn and tenacity. Those who've tried to fight him have learned the hard way that he makes good on his threats.
A short middle-aged stout strig and the sergeant of the Perch Guard in Marshview, he has a great fondness for ale and regularly frequents the Moss Hall inn and tavern.

A band of old hunting buddies, the Ragtaggers are three humblefolk hunters who work together as a team to bring down large quarry. The Ragtaggers are made up of Snap (a thin and shrewd vulpin), Cackle (a good-humored and barrelchested mapach known for his chuckle), and Podge (a very grumpy hedge and the de facto leader of the group). They may appear to be little more than bandit scoundrels, but underneath their suspicious exteriors are three devoted friends who are happy to help wanderers, sometimes even for free.
A seasoned mistral raptor ranger and professional bounty hunter from the Gasparian Isles, Cadwyll is a hardened professional who values his duty above all else.

Caterpedes are the larval form of the cosmoth. These hefty creatures have long, soft bodies with many sucker-like legs. They sport different patterns on their slick skin depending on the variety of cosmoth they will become. Caterpedes have resilient bodies and happily consume incredibly toxic plants and fungi. The poisons from its food are stored in a special organ, which can be cut out to make caterpede meat safe for consumption. However, once caterpedes transform into cosmoths, the poison spreads through their bodies and protects against predators. Wild caterpedes lack this organ, requiring that their meat be carefully purified before consumption.

entries.name: Variant: Toxic Caterpedes
entries: A handful of wild caterpedes can be found in the Wood, and some are toxic. Their meat can be rendered edible through a purify food and drink spell or similar effect, or through careful draining of its internal fluids, requiring 24 hours of preparation and a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to remove its toxins.

Cathus is a middle-aged mapach with gray-and-black fur tinged with a rusty red undercoat that is beginning to turn white in places. He is the owner and proprietor of a small woodland supply depot called The Last Stand, which he uses to support his ward, a young jerbeen boy named Finnan Softpad. Cathus used to work as an enforcer for the Bandit Coalition in the past, and despite his best efforts to leave his criminal past behind him, he still fences stolen goods for the Coalition on the sly.

Christophe, a middle aged huden gallus, is the Rose Hip's owner and teamaster. He has a simple rustic charm which can be intimidating to outsiders, but which the locals have come to know and love him for. He is also an incurable gossip, whose caring and empathetic nature makes it easy for others to open up around him. This, coupled with deep and abiding love for his craft, have helped his establishment to become known throughout the city.

An ancient fey spirit of Humblewood, more commonly known as "the Loper" in various tall tales told by hunters throughout the Wood. It is a docile creature that appears only fleetingly to help lost or injured travelers, before bounding away at incredible speed.

entries.name: Corrupted Rosselbuck
entries: When the Rosselbuck is corrupted by the influence of the thorn of kren it appears as a ghastly bestial creature that only wishes to hunt and kill.

Though not possessing the same magical talent as bards, songweavers have learned to tap into a little of the magic inherent within a song in subtle but effective ways. Skilled songweavers can hold an audience in rapt attention with their voice alone.

Cosmoths are gigantic insects that migrate across Wesden on scintillating wings. They have been bred by farmers over generations into a dazzling array of shapes and colors. In their adult form, their main defense is being inedible to most creatures. Should that fail, cosmoths will defend themselves with their powerful claws.

Slimes are magical oozes with strange properties. Slimes provide an important role in many ecosystems across Humblewood, as their bodies can digest just about anything. The bodies of slimes are also sought after for use in potion making.

entries.name: Cursed Slime
entries: These fearsome looking slimes were once benign, until they became warped and cursed through Lendarick's esoteric experiments.

Drella Swoop is a cheery sera luma able to make conversation with people from all walks of life. She is a con artist who left Alderheart after burning all of her bridges there, and has decided to join the hunters of Reya's Watch in the hopes of swindling them out of some of their more lucrative trophies.

Black-tailed squirrels called dusktails are found across Humblewood. Dusktails are swift, agile, and intelligent. Dusktails can eat just about anything, and are adept at sneaking into seed stores where they can quickly deplete food supplies if given the chance.

Elora Quickwit is a thin, middle-aged kindled corvum and the owner of Moss Hall, Marshview's local inn and tavern. She often overcharges her customers and involves herself in disreputable schemes to turn a profit. Though most of the locals detest her, the perch is too small to boycott her establishment, and she has close ties with Sergeant Burlywhirl, the head of the local Perch Guard.

These two-foot-long beetles have shells in a range of reds, yellows, and oranges, with anywhere from eight to twelve black spots on their back. They are often kept as pets and seen as signs of good luck, as they feast on many common garden pests, including the dreaded gimlet. When threatened, they can ooze a noxious-smelling liquid from their carapace to ward off predators.

entries.name: Fine Familiars
entries: You can summon an everbug as your familiar.

These foot-and-a-half-long wasps are a seasonal pest around Alderheart, drawn to the tree in the summer months by the blooming of giant orchids known as witherhearts. They are named for their red-orange coloration, as well as for the burning pain caused by their venom. Firelances are easily provoked and quick to sting. Firelances possess a potent venom that is coveted by assassins for both its availability and its lethality.

entries.name: Firelance Poison
entries: The venom of the firelance can be brewed into a potent poison that has the following statistics:

entries.name: Firelance Venom (Injury)
entries: This poison is harvested from the venom sac of a dead or incapacitated firelance. A creature subjected to this poison must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@dice 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it is poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points. A single dose of this poison costs 300 gold pieces.

A retired mistral raptor hunter, Frond is the owner and sole employee of Frond's Fineries, the general store in Reya's Watch. She has aspirations of earning enough coin to move her shop to Alderheart.
